sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A, B, and C be sets such that A = {1, 2}, B = {2, 3}, and C = {1, 3}. Compute (A △ B) × C and A △ (B × C). Show that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to the Cartesian product.
